Title: Get All Users

Overview
Retrieves a paginated, sortable list of users from the AddiPi User Service.

Request
- Method: GET
- URL: {{user_url}}/?sort=asc&limit=2

Query Parameters
- sort (string, optional): Sort order for results. Allowed values: asc, desc. Default: asc.
- limit (integer, optional): Max number of users to return. Examples: 2, 10, 50. Use 0 to return all (if supported by the service).

Authentication
- Typically secured. If this service requires auth, use your existing workspace setup (e.g., Bearer token from AddiPi-Auth Service) via environment variables.
- Example header when using Bearer token:
  Authorization: Bearer {{access_token}}

Response
- 200 OK (application/json)
  Example body:
  {
    "users": [
      {
        "id": "user_1764603160153",
        "email": "341479@uwr.edu.pl",
        "firstName": "Oliwer",
        "lastName": "Urbaniak",
        "role": "admin",
        "isVerified": true,
        "createdAt": "2025-12-01T16:32:40,153Z",
        "updatedAt": "2025-12-04T02:29:31,215Z"
      }
      // ...more users
    ],
    "count": 3
  }

Error Responses (examples)
- 401 Unauthorized: Missing or invalid credentials.
- 403 Forbidden: Authenticated but not allowed to list users.
- 500 Server Error: Unexpected server-side failure.

Notes
- This request currently has no pre-request or test scripts. Consider adding tests to assert status 200, validate schema of each user object, and check count matches array length.
- Variables in use: {{user_url}} for base URL.

Change Log
- 2025-12-04: Initial documentation added.

Get user by ID

Summary  
Retrieves a single user resource by its unique identifier.

Method  
GET

URL  
{{user_url}}/user_1764603160153

Path / Query Params

- None. The request targets a concrete user resource by ID embedded in the path.
    

Headers

- Accept: application/json (recommended)
    

Auth

- Inherit auth from parent or use the environment’s configured auth if applicable.
    

Response

- 200 OK: Returns the user record. Example body:
    
    ``` json
    {
    "id": "user_1764603160153",
    "email": "341479@uwr.edu.pl",
    "firstName": "Oliwer",
    "lastName": "Urbaniak",
    "role": "admin",
    "isVerified": true,
    "createdAt": "2025-12-01T16:32:40,153Z",
    "updatedAt": "2025-12-03T02:12:21,748Z",
    "_rid": "…",
    "_self": "…",
    "_etag": "…",
    "_attachments": "attachments/",
    "_ts": 1764724343
    }
    
     ```
    
- 404 Not Found: User with the specified ID does not exist.
    
- 401/403: Authentication or authorization failed (if enforced by the service).
    

Notes

- The base URL is provided by the environment variable {{user_url}}.
    
- This request currently has no pre-request or test scripts and no saved examples. Add tests or examples as needed for monitoring or mocking.

### Update User Role

PATCH {{user_url}}/user_1764603160153/role

Updates the role for a specific user. Use this endpoint to promote/demote a user (e.g., to admin). The response returns the full user object reflecting the updated role.

#### Authentication

- Requires authenticated request (e.g., Bearer access token) with sufficient privileges to manage user roles.
    
- Inherit auth from parent collection/folder if configured.
    

#### Path

- userId (embedded in path): `user_1764603160153`
    

#### Request Body (JSON)

```
{
  "role": "admin"
}

 ```

- role: string (required). Example values: `user`, `admin`. Must match server-allowed roles.
    

#### Sample Request

```
PATCH {{user_url}}/user_1764603160153/role
Content-Type: application/json
{
  "role": "admin"
}

 ```

#### Successful Response (200)

```
{
  "id": "user_1764603160153",
  "email": "341479@uwr.edu.pl",
  "firstName": "Oliwer",
  "lastName": "Urbaniak",
  "role": "admin",
  "isVerified": true,
  "createdAt": "2025-12-01T16:32:40,153Z",
  "updatedAt": "2025-12-04T02:17:07,782Z",
  "_rid": "JvFmANJMdM0JAAAAAAAAAA==",
  "_self": "dbs/JvFmAA==/colls/JvFmANJMdM0=/docs/JvF...",
  "_etag": "\"7e018946-0000-4700-0000-6930e1090000\"",
  "_attachments": "attachments/",
  "_ts": 1764811017
}

 ```

#### Status Codes

- 200 OK: Role updated successfully; returns the updated user.
    
- 400 Bad Request: Invalid role value or body schema.
    
- 401 Unauthorized: Missing/invalid auth.
    
- 403 Forbidden: Authenticated but insufficient privileges to change roles.
    
- 404 Not Found: User does not exist.
    
- 409 Conflict: Update conflict or role transition not allowed.
    
- 429 Too Many Requests: Rate limit exceeded.
    
- 500 Internal Server Error: Unexpected server error.
    

#### Notes

- {{user_url}} is sourced from the active environment (e.g., AddiPi). Ensure it points to the correct User Service base URL.
    
- This request currently uses a raw JSON body and no saved tests or examples.

Purpose  
PATCH a user’s role to admin. This endpoint elevates an existing user to the admin role.

URL and Path Parameters

- Base URL: {{user_url}} (provided by the active environment)
    
- Path: /{userId}/role/{role}
    - userId: The unique user identifier. In the current example it is user_1764603160153.
        
    - role: The target role to assign. In this request it is admin.
        

Variables Used

- {{user_url}}: Environment variable pointing to the User Service base URL (set in the AddiPi environment). Example: [https://api.example.com/users](https://api.example.com/users)
    

Authentication

- Typically requires an authenticated admin or system token. Inherit auth from the parent collection/folder if configured, or set on the request as needed. Ensure the token has permission to update user roles.
    

Request

- Method: PATCH
    
- Body: none
    

Responses

- 200 OK: Role successfully updated. Example (captured response):  
    {  
    "id": "user_1764603160153",  
    "email": "[341479@uwr.edu.pl](https://mailto:341479@uwr.edu.pl)",  
    "firstName": "Oliwer",  
    "lastName": "Urbaniak",  
    "role": "admin",  
    "isVerified": true,  
    "createdAt": "2025-12-01T16:32:40,153Z",  
    "updatedAt": "2025-12-04T02:29:31,215Z",  
    "_rid": "JvFmANJMdM0JAAAAAAAAAA==",  
    "_self": "dbs/JvFmAA==/colls/JvFmANJMdM0=/docs/JvF...",  
    "_etag": ""7e01e168-0000-4700-0000-6930e3f30000"",  
    "_attachments": "attachments/",  
    "_ts": 1764811763  
    }
    
- 400 Bad Request: Invalid role value or malformed userId.
    
- 401 Unauthorized / 403 Forbidden: Missing or insufficient auth to modify roles.
    
- 404 Not Found: userId does not exist.
    
- 409 Conflict: Attempt to set the same role again may be treated as a no-op depending on the service, but some implementations can return conflict.
    
- 5xx: Server error from User Service.
    

Idempotency and Side Effects

- Calling this with role already set to admin should be idempotent (no change in state). The service may still update updatedAt or return the existing resource representation. No resource creation; only a role update.
    

Usage with Environments and Variables

- Set {{user_url}} in the AddiPi environment to your User Service base URL. Duplicate environments for different stages (e.g., Dev/QA/Prod) and switch the active environment to target the desired stage.
    
- To elevate a different user or role, edit the path segments directly in the request URL (or create a path variableized version using a collection-level variable like {{user_id}} and {{target_role}} for reuse in collection runs/monitors).
